I am an occupational therapist and work in a Community Mental Health Team in Cornwall. I live with Martyn and our spaniel cross Reggie. I have lived in Cheshire, Derbyshire, Suffolk, Merseyside, North Yorkshire, and currently the Tamar Valley. In my spare time, I enjoy reading, watching films and TV, walking, nature, the countryside, jigsaws, colouring, and embroidery. My main hobby is taking photos of Devon, Cornwall, and sometimes further a field. I'm also practising my street photography.

This is the official Mastodon account for Democrats Abroad, the Democratic Party arm for the millions of Americans living outside the US. We strive to provide Americans abroad with a Democratic voice in our government and to elect Democratic candidates by mobilizing the overseas vote.

If you're a US citizen who lives abroad, YOU CAN VOTE in the upcoming #2024Election.

To register, or get overseas voting information for your state, go to http://VoteFromAbroad.org.

We post daily.

I'm a nocturnal autistic artist, website designer and developer, and programmer. I make geisha, Japanese, water, lipstick, video game, medical art, Biblical art, fan art, and abstract art. note: Michael de Adder was a political cartoonist for The Washington Post. De Adder was born in Moncton, NB, in 1967 and a graduate of Mount Allison University with a degree in Fine Arts. note: Philosophy professor at the University of Twente, author of #NihilismAndTechnology (Rowman-Littlefield 2018), of #Nihilism (MIT Press, 2019), and of various articles and op-eds. I write about why technologies like social media are dangerous, not because they are "bad" or "addictive", but because they make us happy and miserable while redefining what "happiness" and "misery" mean. This is why I spend so much time on social media. For the research. I swear...
